page.title: 02Ashbourne Shrove Football 1
page.content: The game was started over{300 years {ago}and was played between{Compton {village}and{Ashbourne village.}The {Uppards}play into the goal at{Sturston which is the axle of the old mill wheel. The{Downards}goal is in{Clifton which is a rock. The goals are three miles apart. To score a goal you have to hit the goal{three times. The ball is made of leather stuffed with cork shavings and stitched with waxed thread. It is brightly painted with topical pictures. Each year on {Shrove Tuesday}a{famous person}throws the ball up to start the game.On{Ash {Wednesday}a{local person}is chosen. The game is played all over the town, in the streets and the river until late at night.Whoever goals the ball keeps it.
